subject: p13078497
History: -year-old male with history of chronic interstitial lung disease, now intubated.
Findings: The patient has a history of chronic interstitial lung disease with waxing and waning pulmonary edema and infection. Today it is largely unchanged with diffuse infiltrative and interstitial opacities stable since. Bilateral pleural effusion is essentially the same. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable and demonstrates mild cardiomegaly. There is no pneumothorax. Enteric tube is seen once again, entering the stomach and then out of field of view. Right-sided PICC terminates within the mid SVC. An endotracheal tube terminates no less than 6 cm from the carina.
Impression: Study is essentially unchanged from priors with unchanged diffuse infiltrative and interstitial opacities.
